channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [OOZIE-1950] Coordinator job info should support timestamp (nominal time)
item.description: It will be useful for user to list all actions (with length and offset) after/before nominal time.
item.summary: Coordinator job info should support timestamp (nominal time)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

+1 DISTRO

----------------------------
-1 Overall result, please check the reported -1(s)

The full output of the test-patch run is available at

. https://builds.apache.org/job/oozie-trunk-precommit-build/1490/

Can someone review this please?

Also, how do I look at the exact lines causing these failures:
-1 the patch contains 1 line(s) with tabs
-1 the patch contains 2 line(s) longer than 132 characters
-1 the patch seems to introduce 16 new javac warning(s)

Shwetha,

-1 the patch contains 1 line(s) with tabs

If you are using eclipse, you can view the whitespace characters, Windows -> Preferences -> General -> Editors -> Text Editors. There you have option to Show whitespace characters. If you check mark that, you can view the tabs, spaces and trailing spaces.

-1 the patch contains 2 line(s) longer than 132 characters
You can identify lines which are beyond 132 characters using Print margin column setting to 132. Can be found following same directions as above.

-1 the patch seems to introduce 16 new javac warning(s)
I believe eclipse will show default warnings. For example unused imports, variable not used, etc.,

Committed to trunk. Thanks Puru and Rohini for reviewing
This is not checked into 4.1 yet.

bowenzhangusa
This is a new feature and not bug fix. Why does it have to go into 4.1?
The creator of the jira marked it as fixed version 4.1.

I marked it as 4.1. We have usecases of getting coord actions whose nominal time is between some start and end time. We used to do this by setting offset = start action number.(yes, offset is for pagination, but served the purpose). But in 4.1, there is purging of coord actions for active coordinators. So, using offset is not an option anymore. So, we need this feature.
Committed to branch-4.1

Oozie Cli help doesn't print information on nominal time, shwethags can you please fix that?

 oozie job <OPTIONS> : job operations
                -action <arg>          coordinator rerun on action ids (requires -rerun);
                                       coordinator log retrieval on action ids (requires -log)
                -auth <arg>            Select authentication type [YCA|BOUNCER|KERBEROS|SIMPLE]
                -change <arg>          change a coordinator job
                -config <arg>          job configuration file '.xml' or '.properties'
                -configcontent <arg>   job configuration
                -coordinator <arg>     bundle rerun on coordinator names (requires -rerun)
                -D <property=value>    set/override value for given property
                -date <arg>            coordinator/bundle rerun on action dates (requires -rerun);
                                       coordinator log retrieval on action dates (requires -log)
                -definition <arg>      job definition
                -doas <arg>            doAs user, impersonates as the specified user
                -dryrun                Supported in Oozie-2.0 or later versions ONLY - dryrun or
                                       test run a coordinator job, job is not queued
                -filter <arg>          status=<S1>[;status=<S2>]* (All Coordinator actions
                                       satisfying any one of the status filters will be retreived.
                                       Currently, only supported for Coordinator job)
                -info <arg>            info of a job
puru, additional patch that fixes the doc
Committed to trunk and 4.1. Thanks Puru for reviewing it

puru, shwethags, I'm seeing some discrepancies in how this was committed to the two branches. Was this on purpose?

master has this, which branch-4.1 does not have:
https://github.com/apache/oozie/commit/d5cd976a80e17f258050c02bd03891e82820b9ac

Both branches have the second part, but they're different:
branch-4.1: https://github.com/apache/oozie/commit/1b069ed28a52981c71218828afaddc328d7dbc37
master: https://github.com/apache/oozie/commit/c69d98c912c5d7a034d0a6dc7d27a08dcf0ed7a7

Looks like the first part did get committed to branch-4.1; just without the "OOZIE-1950" part, so I didn't see it before:
https://github.com/apache/oozie/commit/b57ee5cb3ed2e5603a641d9e3bb8f6cc32036c6e

However, the second part is still different. In the end, it looks like the only discrepancy is some docs that weren't updated.
